many unanswered questions about too many important people, companies and institutions...[ This] suggests that David Cameron 's lack of judgment over Andy Coulson is even more striking." uncomfortable questions remain for the prime minister. This affair casts serious doubt on the prime minister's judgment. He saw fit to appoint Mr Andy Coulson as the Conservative party's director of communications when the former editor was tarred by association with the phone-hacking scandal. Why would he want such a compromised spokesman? Was he naive enough to believe Mr Andy Coulson 's assurances? Or did he not care about what had taken place? Neither scenario is very comforting.
